headline: Fluffy Peanut Butter Frosting
description: This peanut butter frosting, made with four ingredients, is creamy, fluffy, and the perfect topping for fudge brownies, cupcakes, and chocolate cake.

video.description: See how to make the perfect frosting for brownies or cakes.
video.name: Fluffy Peanut Butter Frosting

name: Fluffy Peanut Butter Frosting

recipeInstructions.text: Beat peanut butter and butter in a medium bowl until creamy and combined.
Gradually blend in sugar; when the mixture thickens, begin incorporating milk, 1 tablespoon at a time, until frosting is thick and spreadable.
Beat on high speed until light and fluffy, about 3 minutes.

review.reviewBody: Made as directed and loved it. Perfect consistency for on top of a chocolate cake.
I loved the taste of that fluffy creamy frosting made it multiple times for family.
I added just a pinch of salt to highlight the peanut butter
This is what I think Heaven would taste like if you could eat it. I ate spoonfuls. Thank you for making this available.
Very easy to make, delicious if you love peanut butter
Loved the flavor and tasted great on brownies. Put some dark cocoa in it and made it taste chocolatey.
Super fast n easy. Spread perfectly over chocolate cake n is soooo light!
Outstanding! Great flavor. My chocolate cup cakes with peanut butter frosting was the star of the desserts

This frosting is full of peanut butter flavor! I frost devil food cake and chunk it up and put it in a container and place it in the fridge to snack on for the week. I top it with whip cream. It is Heaven every scoop.

This is my go-to recipe for Peanut Butter Frosting. It is delicious...tastes like the inside of a peanut butter cup. I have never had an issue with graininess...if it starts getting hard to mix, I add a bit of milk. It's never as smooth and shiny as chocolate or vanilla buttercream but it spreads just as easily. I always use Jif...I don't think natural peanut butter will work. I make it vegan by using vegan butter and unsweetened plant milk. Heaven.
No changes needed for me at least. It is by far some of the best frosting I have ever made myself
Reminds me of the stuff my granny made.

This is the best PB frosting. I don’t get why there are bad reviews. I have made several times and followed exactly as directed. Not greasy. Very spreadable. Not too sweet. Sometimes I add whipped topping to it to make it lighter and easier to spread but only because I love cool whip!

This recipe produced a delicious fluffy frosting with just the right amount of sweetness. I used it to top an 8x8 single-layer dark chocolate cake. I only had cream and not milk, and it worked for me! I definitely recommend giving this frosting a try!

I decided on this recipe for my chocolate cupcake parfaits for our PTO bake sale. It does taste good and they came out good but I was hoping for it to be a little thicker than it was. Although it tastes good It almost feels like it’s missing something. Either way they all sold out

Here is how make it fluffy. Temperate is the key. In a cool kitchen, start with room temperature peanut butter in the automatic mixer. Mix it a bit to cream it and prepare it for the butter. Add the butter but don’t use warm butter or soft butter. Use cooler than room temp butter but not just out of the refrigerator. The butter will soften gradually. Once incorporated fully add 1/3 the sugar fresh out of the fridge will keep the oils from separating also, a tablespoon very cold milk right off the bat. Do that a second time and judge yourself if you need more milk on the final round. What we are really doing is playing with the temperature of the butter within the recipe. Letting the friction of the mixing peanut butter melt the butter then cooling it again with cold sugar and milk is a delicate dance but can make the creamiest and fluffiest. Refrigeration recommend anyways because there’s milk in the recipe. Hope this helps. I’ll send pics when I got a better cam. Good luck
This recipe is great! I didn't add all of the milk and added 1/4 cup more peanut butter. YUMMY!
Real good! Recommended tates amazing.
TERRIBLE. Never again. It came out like oatmeal tasted fine but the consistency is terrible.

I thought this was very good. Ate way too much of it. Came out nice and fluffy. Used butter at room temp and I always cut my butter up so it blends easier. I wish I had seen other reviews about putting in vanilla. I did add just a touch of extra milk so it was a little more spreadable.

I only measured the peanut butter and the butter, the rest I did according to taste and consistency. Then I added dark chocolate power (for hot chocolate--not baking chocolate) I used it all on a 3 layer cake. I also had to mix by hand because I don't know where my hand mixer is and didn't want to use my Kitchenaid. I am not the best decorator, but don't care-I know it taste good. We had unexpectant company--had the cakes in the freezer, just needed some frosting.

I made this for a chocolate cake and it knocked it out of the park. I added a smidgeon extra milk and wish I had added just a bit more just to make it a little more spreadable. Tasted fabulous however and I plan to use this recipe again for any future chocolate cakes.

Wow! This recipe is a winner! I’m my kitchen aid mixer I started by creaming the room temperature butter until nice and fluffy. I then added the peanut butter until it was nice and smooth and I could no longer see the butter. Very slowly I added the confectioners sugar. I would pause and scrape the bowl intermittently. It then became nice and whipped. I slowly added the milk one tablespoon at a time. In the end I only needed two tablespoons to achieve the consistency I wanted for spreading on the cake and piping. If you follow the recipe and are patient with the mixing and whipping of this frosting I promise the results are magical! It was delicious! And the saltiness in the peanut butter and I also used salted butter helped cut the sweetness of my chocolate cake.

I love peanut butter icing and have always used my mom/grandma’s recipe (not much different from this) but I lost the card and don’t feel like bugging my mom for it!! So anyways I used natural peanut butter so I’m thinking maybe that’s why mine was more like fudge and not easy to spread… the taste was good maybe I’ll look for a different one for natural peanut butter
It was too creamy, could get it actul frosting consiconsistency
The recipe was easy and tasted like peanut butter. My husband loves peanut butter and he loved it.

This stuff is THE BEST. I put it on the on bowl chocolate cake (cupcakes). I put a dab of chocolate fudge in the middle of my cupcakes. Topped the whole thing off with some chopped up Resee’s cups. PERFECT! I got so many compliments at my daughter’s birthday.

ALWAYS sift the powdered sugar, then measure. I added a splash of pure vanilla. It adds just a little something to the taste. I used this recipe to fill too much chocolate cupcakes then iced them with milk chocolate icing and 1/2 of a mini–Reese Cup on top. Rave reviews and no remaining cupcakes to take home. I would definitely use this recipe but would continue to add vanilla.
I used Swerve, powdered erythritol. Good. Simple. I piped it onto Duncan Hines Keto brownies.
Excellent flavor & alot less sugar than most! I ended up using nearly 4 tsp. of milk & added 1/2 - 3/4 tsp. of vanilla flavoring.

I'm not much of a frosting person, but man.. this is GOOD, I could've ate it by the spoon full! 
Super easy to make, it spreads easily and the taste/texture is great. It's sweet, but not sickly sweet so it paired well with the brownies my daughter and I made. 
Definitely keeping this recipe on hand!
Love this recipe, only complaint is that it’s pretty sweet. So I cut that with some salt, added some vanilla extract, and whipped cream to make it extra fluffy.

I've made this recipe before. Very good taste! I noticed this time that the more I beat it, the less spreadable it became. I'm not sure why. I used Jif and Skippy (about 1/2 and 1/2) because it's what I had. I don't remember what PB brand I used before. To make it more spreadable after beating it, I added a couple tablespoons of heavy cream. I haven't frosted my cake yet, but I think it will be fine.
I made it using almond butter
My husband and kids are big Peanut butter fans. I like Pb sometimes however this pb frosting is pretty good .everyone uses left over frosting on bread and Crackers lol

I'm not quite sure what all the negative reviews are about, but this frosting was amazing. I followed the directions to a "T" and used my stand mixer. I mixed it at a level 3 for 3 minutes and it fluffed right up and spread like butter. My husband took a bite and said "Wow, this is amazing". Great recipe.

I am not a huge fan of peanut butter, but this frosting is crazy good! I made it exactly according to the directions, and it is not overly sweet, and it is the perfect texture for piping. This is a definite keeper!?
I have made this frosting several times. My family loves it. I admit that I have reduced the powered sugar down to 1 1/2 cups or less. Still taste wonderful.
it goes perfect on cake

I used evaporated milk with my batch and a teaspoon of Vanilla extract. It was so easy to make. Be sure to use real butter and make sure it is at room temperature. Take time to combine the butter and peanut butter thoroughly before adding the sugar and milk.
Loved this frosting, will definitely be making it again!

DON'T MIND IF I DO!! Made this recipe for a birthday cake for my brother. It turned a boring devil's food box mix into a winner of a cake! I did add a little salt to highlight the peanut butter... and a little bourbon. Used this frosting as the filler between layers, did a simple chocolate ganache glaze, and then swirls of more peanut butter frosting on top, decorated with Reese's peanut butter chips. *chef's kiss* Made this 3 months ago and I'm still thinking about it!
This was absolutely horrible; felt like ten pounds of concrete - so thick and heavy. Find a different recipe.

This was great icing recipe. I didn’t give 5 stars only because I didn’t follow recipe exactly so I don’t know if it would have been the same. What I did different was I used about 1/4 - 1/2 cup more peanut butter and about 2/3 the recommended sugar. I also didn’t have milk and used heavy cream. I added the cream a bit at a time until I was happy with the consistency. I used for a layer cake and it was perfect!

This recipe is great! I made it to put on some banana muffins for my dog's birthday (long story). I haven't tried it on the muffins yet, but I ate a little bit of the extra. It's a bit on the sweet side, but that's okay imo
Absolutely terrible.
So delicious!!! I took out 1/2 c of sugar to make it a little less sweet for my taste. Fluffy, creamy, and addictive!
recipe tasted good but wasn’t fluffy at all and i’ve made it multiple times. alright on cupcakes but terrible for cake impossible to get smooth

I am an experienced chef, and I seldom have a problem with a recipe, but this turned into a horrible curdled mess. I made 1 -1/2 times the recipe because I wanted to frost 2 dozen cup cakes. I made this in my stand mixer and had all the ingredients at room temperature. After I added the first two cups of sugar, the frosting looked light and creamy, but when I added the third cup of sugar (remember I increased the recipe quantity) the frosting became much too hard--more like making buckeyes than frosting. As directed, I added more milk, a tablespoon at a time, and suddenly the recipe curdled. No matter how much I beat it, it was a horrible greasy mess and a waste of my time and ingredients. Nasty.
yummy!
This was by far the most beautiful icing I have ever used for piping. And my family couldn’t get enough of it! This is my go to pb icing from now on!

Great recipe! I whipped the butter and peanut butter together first. I live in a high humidity area. After adding the powdered sugar, the milk (I used chocolate) was added in a teaspoon at a time. This is definitely going in the tried and true file!

I followed the recommendation of a reviewer (Cyndie Schneider) and beat the peanut butter and butter together until super creamy, used less powdered sugar, and used milk to get the right consistency to spread on a 9 x 13" chocolate cake. Everyone loved it, very fluffy and creamy!
The frosting was easy to make and tasted great.
This frosting is Delicious, it's perfect for my brownies

This is the best peanut butter frosting I have ever had. It is so light and fluffy without all the sweetness of most frostings. My son and his now-wife had cupcakes at their wedding frosted with this!
This recipe is awesome. The icing is yummy. The directions are clear. I really appreciate this!!
I followed the recipe EXACTLY and I could not get a fluffy, spreadable frosting! I also thought it was a bit too sweet. Oh well, to each his own!

It is absolutely delicious and so easy to make. I was very pleased with the taste and texture. If you love peanut butter you'll like this. It is great for cake or cupcakes. I'll use this recipe again.

Made this and found it was too sweet, not peanut buttery or salty enough, so added more peanut butter, and the family loved it! Just add 1 tbsp PB until it suits you. Wonderful recipe I am adding to my regulars. Added a little 1/4 PB cup on top for my daughter's equestrian bday, would look cute with oreo cookie sprinkles too for dirt but had none on hand. Thanks so much for sharing.
This reminds me of the filling for Buckeye candy in flavor -- it's not as stiff, of course. Delicious frosting for my brownies.

I absolutely loved this recipe. I am a 14-year-old freshman in high school and I love to bake but can never come up with my own recipes. I followed all the instructions and it came out perfectly. I frosted my fudge brownies with it and my family loved it. I definitely recommend.
Perfect! Not overly sweet, it’s a perfect compliment to the One Bowl Chocolate Cake on this site.

This recipe is amazing; I'm looking for an excuse to make it again! I don't like super-sweet icing, and this recipe hit the spot.... just the right amount of sweet, light & fluffy, flavor reminds me of Reese's. I used it to ice chocolate cupcakes (great combo!), and it covered 22 cupcakes well. The consistency piped easily. The recipe was super-easy to make, exactly as written. One thing I will add, in response to the people with flops..... I followed the advice of a professional baker, who said she ALWAYS uses WHOLE milk in her icing, and that the milk and (REAL) butter MUST be room temperature. It's a simple thing, but this makes a real difference!
This frosting is perfect, Fluffy and delicious ! It made the perfect amount for 24 devils food cupcakes.

This is the best peanut butter frosting I’ve ever made or had! It comes out very fluffy and it has the perfect amount of sweetness to it! Make sure you use real butter instead of margarine or it won’t come out right. Real butter is better for you anyways! I use butter made with canola oil and it always turns out great!
Nice consistency. And flavor is wonderful. Not sweet at all. But I did use swerve instead of regular sugar. Flavor is really good.
Amazing.

Great recipe! I actually used organic peanut butter (with no added sugar) and it emulsified perfectly when mixed. I also used only 1 cup of icing sugar. It was perfectly smooth, fluffy, and so delicious!
I followed the recipe exactly, except for the milk.. I used hazelnut creamer instead of milk. I will definitely save this recipe for future use.
This was so easy and so good
This is terrible! It's so greasy and unspreadable. It dose'nt pipe well, reminds me of Play-Doh. Bad choice for my son's second birthday.
smooth tasting

I have never felt compelled to write a review, but I did after making this. I followed the recipe exactly and while it does get a thumbs up for the flavor it was a nightmare to frost cupcakes using a pastry bag and tip. It was so thick I gave up and just ended pressing a dollop on each cupcake with a spatula. It was no where close to being creamy and light when made per the exact recipe.
I increased the PB to 1 1/4 cups and reduced the powdered sugar to 1 1/2 cups and only needed half the milk. Followed the recipe exactly otherwise and it was delicious.
Made exactly as recipe says and didn't turn out at all!! Was making this for my daughters 30th Birthday! Very disappointed!
Absolutely heavenly! Made with chocolate cake for my husband and couldn’t get my beater back from him! So good!!

I think this recipe is spot on! I followed the recipe exactly as written, and it’s so fluffy and delicious. I can’t wait for my father in law to get here. So very easy. I love it. Thanks for the great recipe! Enjoy your weekend!
SO good!!
Followed the recipe exactly and it turned out AMAZING!
I had to add a little salt to cut down the sweetness, but after that it tasted amazing! If I ever had a reason to make peanut butter frosting again, I would definitely use this recipe!

I pretty much followed the recipe with the exception to the portion of butter. I had a bit less than a stick at room temp and that seems to have worked out well. Now, if I just stop eating the scrumptious chocolate cupcakes frosted with this yummy peanutbutter frosting.

I really liked the consistency and the great taste of this frosting. My mom and i dont make frosting too often and the frosting is almost always substandard. But this recipe pleasantly surprised us. The few changes we made were:
Peanut butter and sugar in a 1:1 ratio- so basically we didnt want to make it too sweet and so we halved the sugar.
This change made us use not more than 1-2 tbsp milk.
(And this might sound funny but we used crunchy peanut butter. We love it.)

I found this recipe to be pretty flawless. I used maybe 1/4 cup less of powdered sugar and maybe just two tbsp of half and half (it’s what I had), and I had no issues with texture and spreading. This covered a 9 inch layer cake perfectly with no leftovers (bummer...it was so good I could have sat down with a spoon and bowl lol!). My granddaughter totally approved of this for her first birthday cake, as did other family members, including my peanut butter loving hubby :).
Delicious! Silky smooth and not too sweet!

First time making this and it turned out perfect. I set everything out and let them get to room temperature, and followed what the video said. I only used about 2tsp of milk. Frosted a 9x13 chocolate cake, with left over.
We love in on our brownie. I did have to add extra milk to get to fluffy and spreadable
Made this and added it to the Extreme Chocolate Cake recipe for a Reeses-type treat. Oh mylanta it was delicious!!!
Great recipe

This is a fluffy, very peanut butter flavored frosting. I used a touch over 3 tbs milk after it looked a bit thick. I used Trader Joe’s peanut butter Which is a much stronger flavor than jiff. VERY or a peanut butter frostings
Half a batch is perfect for an 8x8 pan of brownies. Yum!

Lovely recipe!!! I read reviews and checked out pics...Followed this recipe as is...I gradually added the milk 1tbsp at a time.. didnt need as much milk, prob 2tbsp at most. Came out Fluffy, easy to spread, and just a nice equal amount of pb and sweetness..It was perfect for my brownies ..I added a thin layer with enough left for another batch ...I froze it till then. ..Next time I'm going to try honey roasted pb and less sugar...Yummy!

Tasted great on my chocolate cake! I was tasting as I went and ended up only using about 2/3 of the recommended amount of powdered sugar. Next time I’m going to try a larger ratio of peanut butter. The flavor of peanut in my finished product was a bit mellower than I was looking for.
2 words: SO GOOD

Absolutely awesome!!! The people on here giving this frosting low marks are the failure not the recipe. I substituted 1t of vanilla for some of the milk. I've made this many many times, its never been too greasy or stiff. Love it.
This is my fav peanut butter frosting to make. It’s very light and not terribly sweet which I enjoy. Really goes great on everything. My latest was making it to go on homemade sugar cookies. Yum!

great frosting. super duper fluffy. used real butter and extra crunchy peanut butter, both at room temperature produced a beautifully light and fluffy peanut-y frosting. I sift my confectioner's sugar to add air to it and break up clumps. added just a few drops of caramel extract to compliment. frosted a depression era chocolate cake.
Best peanut butter frosting recipe ever! Tasty and spreads easily!
Turned out wonderful thank you.
